pullRequest.body:
Add lemmas about Galois extensions, especially the special case of the Galois correspondence.
Co-authored-by:  Yongle Hu <mbkybky@gmail.com> Nailin Guan <3571819596@qq.com> Jingting Wang <wangjingting2023@stu.pku.edu.cn>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17197

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0ce709ae07](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16979/commits/0ce709ae074aa59b06c86b311eb201f15e22a6e6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_apply`
`+ IntermediateField.restrictNormalHom_ker`
`+ Normal.of_conjugate_fixed`
`+ fixingSubgroup_normal_of_isGalois`
`+ liftAlgEquiv`
`+ liftAlgEquiv_apply`
`+ map_fixingSubgroup`
`+ normalAutEquivQuotient`
`+ normalAutEquivQuotient_apply`
`+ of_fixedField_normal_subgroup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17197~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This PR seems to have overlap with #16978. Also the "Moves: ..." part of the PR description does not seem accurate any more.
This is all the lemmas needed for the incoming PRs #16982 and #16993 , but some is still needed in #16978, do I need to remove the overlaping part or work on this PR first?

> This is all the lemmas needed for the incoming PRs #16982 and #16993 , but some is still needed in #16978, do I need to remove the overlaping part or work on this PR first?

Do you mean that #16978 depends on this PR? If this is the case, please mark it there and add the blocked-by-other-PR label (add it also to the other two PR's that depend on this one).
#16978 can be handled seperately, but should I remove the overlaping part? Because some lemmas in this PR is also used in #16979, I think I should just remove them for now.

> #16978 can be handled seperately, but should I remove the overlaping part? Because some lemmas in this PR is also used in #16979

Well, if nothing in #16978 needs what is in this PR, then yes, you should remove the overlap: once this PR will be merged the results will be in `master`  and there will be no need to re-add them through #16978. Even better, as soon as this one is merged, when you will update master on #16978, this will import these new lemmas there, so there will be no need to add them manually. All in all, a certain def/lemma should appear in a PR only if
1. You are trying to add it to master 
2. You need it for the other results of that PR.

slight golf
```suggestion
    rintro σ x ⟨a, ha, rfl⟩ τ
    exact (symm_apply_eq σ).mp (ha ⟨σ⁻¹ * τ * σ, Subgroup.Normal.conj_mem' hn τ.1 τ.2 σ⟩)
```

Could you separate out the lemma that the `(restrictNormalHom (fixedField H)).ker = H`? Also, I wonder if `(L ≃ₐ[K] L) ⧸ H ≃* ((fixedField H) ≃ₐ[K] (fixedField H))` might be the more natural direction? (At least, that direction has a nice API lemma that you could add).
Sorry, what API lemma?

A lemma that says that if you start with a automorphism of `L`, map it to an automorphism of `fixedField H`, apply it to an element of `fixedField H`, and coerce to `L`, then you get the same answer as if you just immediately coerce to `L` and apply the automorphism of `L`.
Added after `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom`, named as `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_apply`

I feel like this lemma might be more naturally stated as `(E.map σ).fixingSubgroup = MulAut.conj σ • E.fixingSubgroup` maybe called `fixingSubgroup_map` or `map_fixingSubgroup` (I never know which way around it should go). This would also make the proof of `fixingSubgroup_normal_of_isGalois` slightly simpler.
Restated, the proof is simplified.

```suggestion
def lift_algEquiv (E : IntermediateField K L) (F : IntermediateField K E) : ↥F ≃ₐ[K] lift F where
  toFun x := ⟨x.1.1,(mem_lift x.1).mpr x.2⟩
  invFun x := ⟨⟨x.1, lift_le F x.2⟩, (mem_lift ⟨x.1, lift_le F x.2⟩).mp x.2⟩
  left_inv := congrFun rfl
  right_inv := congrFun rfl
  map_mul' _ _ := rfl
  map_add' _ _ := rfl
  commutes' _ := rfl
```
Can you also add a version like `AlgEquiv.restrictNormal_commutes` that works in general and not just for intermediate fields?
(or maybe just that version, since this `IntermediateField` version is just a special case)
I think this lemma already exists, but I prefer to still have one for intermediate field because it is more frequently used. This is only an unfold away from restrictNormalHom applying on an element.
Fair enough. Although it does feel a bit weird to have `AlgEquiv.restrictNormal` have a general lemma but `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom` to have a lemma just for intermediate fields.
Can you add the same sort of API lemma for this def as well?
It should pretty much be the same as `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_apply`, except with an extra map from `(L ≃ₐ[K] L)` to `(L ≃ₐ[K] L) ⧸ H` before plugging `σ` into `normalAutEquivQuotient`.
Added, but do I need to add one more about the composition of `QuotientGroup.mk'` and `normalAutEquivQuotient` is equal to `restrictNormalHom`

```suggestion
  simp [Subgroup.ext_iff, AlgEquiv.ext_iff, IntermediateField.fixingSubgroup,
    mem_fixingSubgroup_iff, Subtype.ext_iff, AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_apply]
```

```suggestion
lemma AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_ker (E : IntermediateField K L) [Normal K E]:
```

Maybe just use the coercion?
```suggestion
    normalAutEquivQuotient H σ = (restrictNormalHom (fixedField H)) σ := rfl
```
Maybe there should be a `simp`-lemma `IntermediateField.mem_fixingSubgroup_iff` to avoid having to unfold the definition of `IntermediateField.fixingSubgroup`.

```suggestion
  simp only [coe_map, AlgHom.coe_coe, Set.mem_image, SetLike.mem_coe, AlgEquiv.smul_def,
    forall_exists_index, and_imp, forall_apply_eq_imp_iff₂, Subtype.forall,
    Subgroup.mem_pointwise_smul_iff_inv_smul_mem, ← symm_apply_eq,
    IntermediateField.fixingSubgroup, mem_fixingSubgroup_iff]
  rfl
```

```suggestion
  rw [← fixingSubgroup_conjugate_of_map, normal_iff_forall_map_eq'.mp inferInstance σ]
```
Isn't `{G : Type*} [Group G]` already defined as a variable in this file?
Would `IntermediateField.restrictNormalHom_ker` be a better name, to enable dot-notation?
Perhaps `IntermediateField.map_fixingSubgroup`?

I don't this is used anywhere, but if you intend to keep it, could you add some basic API like `lift_algEquiv_apply`?

(Also, maybe it should be called `liftAlgEquiv` since it's a def and not a theorem?)

This lemma would be used in the incoming PR #16982 because I got trouble proving the lift of a Galois intermediatefield is also Galois, maybe there are better ways to solve it. But at least for now I should add `liftAlgEquiv_apply`

```suggestion
  toFun x := ⟨x.1.1, (mem_lift x.1).mpr x.2⟩
```

```suggestion
lemma IntermediateField.restrictNormalHom_ker (E : IntermediateField K L) [Normal K E] :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(FieldTheory/Galois): Lemmas of galois theory
